item.title: spring-summer 2023
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: fighting for my life, from my desk to the Uintas
item.content:encoded: spring wave pummels sadness washes up, rot in my brain, smoke in the Texas air portends a life, disastrous storms for weeks and Ventus’ heavy sighs : taps on skylight glass summer wind tones cresting Uintas&rsquo; ridge, birds court bees pine scent, citronella smoke swirls, chipmunk’s chirp me! lake in the mountains triangle, edges of dead trees salamander hunting grounds corner of my eye an eye around the corner, a wary stranger

item.title: fall-winter 2022-2023
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall noble warrior Thisis, solemn and true &ndash; great autumn oak guardian on the river&rsquo;s vanishing edge hear his cry, a plea for esteem betrayal, reveals the flower of anger a true being Stillness in fall’s ancient air, Symmetry wheel grinds the autumn windstorm Beneath her feet looking out these big moments &ndash; seem so small breeze on skin &ndash; peace on surface water one long summer gasp out front white lake line murmurs, flowers whistle orphaned leaves dancing a war in overhead grass dots the orange sky winter unknown purpose - they search for so long in a cloudy sky hummingbird dodges, coursing standstill raindrops, please flip switch the spring!

item.title: spring-summer 2022
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: final girl in the Vandy horror picture show moves to Austin
item.content:encoded: spring purple blooms | for the first time in years they crunch beneath my old-aged thoughts my sum of work traverses two pages :: last Tennessee spring internal forces full moon in Pisces quit deluding! summer sweet smell of white wildflowers ~«~«≈…‡…‡…‡ blue moons eclipse at an angle then move away birds flock to cedar leaves, one last go air hums in cosmic threads at midnight

item.title: winter 2021-2022
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: immense freedom, relief, and growth in what felt like the coldest winter
item.content:encoded: ear wind of walking through plain of grass | overhead daddy fishing :: a Star in my lens before the falls city search for sex sounds and sin : morning cloud ahead The Mat is an Ontology for Yoga body aches under oppressive light of clear winter pupils burn as cold sun peers behind branches flock of days already far away still undone blue fields of teeming aura bestow: life peace found in a puff jacket &ndash; winter’s green alone in bed but not my own :: drunk head open heart pasted to the window one eye open zen numbness after my youth, cathartic hairy sex storm’s warmth after my abandon youth at winter’s end a cloudy sky : offering clarity never known feather wisps courting chirps at last :: only edges freeze

item.title: fall 2021
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall numbing :: I feel nothing but feel the numbness nine friends bathing in the pool of fallen oak leaves flock of birds leaves in the wind shift in unison seventieth page the answer to my problem on an oak leaf hard stare my mind-body is zen autumn blows in different pretty shaped pink geranium in autumn twilight yellow maple blesses us all with autumn broken toe on my 24th birthday Autumn’s rebirth sometimes &ndash; it all just comes together in one house, for moving beings still autumn breeze my beginning ahead, gaze up my journey’s trail, behind my ends cornucopia : i love that word so much gradient from the autumn maple cone&rsquo;s tip holly&rsquo;s fruit infect leafless branches of a Yule tree

item.title: spring-summer 2021
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: end of undergrad and feeling like the end is in sight
item.content:encoded: spring dogwoods wish petals sending warm love &ndash; ambient footsteps first crop &ndash; gradually startles a Conscience dreams of farms and glory sweaty sinews; love’s rhythm two days in a row battle, good and evil no grey in community past shame some how withers I harden first world problem is privilege knowing life ends well how long? my child trains dimensions filtered &hellip; unfiltered filter summer My cats, Amie (left) and Chaussure (right). dogwood blooms &ndash; love each other, overflowing the edge of the pond residential concrete crow caws to robin unfenced front yard words light the gas doubt billows from the subcortex &ndash; gloom sizzles inside cloudy waves their turbulent serenity reflecting lifetime serotonin spurs inspiration &hellip; for sunburnt shoulders Haiku summer &ndash; Reading poet’s names A big world building your own website = pure ontology atop a slant there is the hospital storm &hellip; pending binary songbird : leaps from signpost to branch on leeward gust city’s peace : my father’s infinite chagrin vanishes phone eats first the simple dishes are rarely bland ball moss&hellip; between my fingertips springs trickle image search is mother of us all &ndash; in a desolate scape heat in the shade &ndash; cocktail opposed to coffee shunning me again pixel rain falling to a dubstep beat L, L L hacking away at wood and python also my forehead poems are my spells cast away free chilly morning dew : shapes the river valley crescent of clouds summer eve &ndash; together on the wood the taste of sambal warmth of coffee at the Korean market a heartfelt friend sister and brother : mother is kind rectress teaching her sun

item.title: winter 2020-2021
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: quiet and rainy windows are closed, but listen world solitude devotion &ndash; sun that invites you upon inspection seated on winter grass &ndash; computer juxtaposed for final studies this is a coup trump = white supremacy is domestic terrorism carbonation, sip the popping bubbles winter rainfall snow not sticking &ndash; a son honors his father claiming his mantle screen replays gaming loops before me day lost to clouds watching romances traces of myself in every lip’s furl surprise, my kidneys! who knows what occurs beneath skin tree in the wind just so happy to be here bright clouds, cold blue : dark window opened growth of epochs cold inspection for the cold veggie harvest &ndash; in warm clothes the repeat burglar saunters through those aisles again

item.title: fall 2020
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.description: we were alive, but really we were dead
item.content:encoded: swordsmen sing among equinox flowers a fawn forages specter sets a trap around corners grow shadows no moon in skull town scale, fearless that spiny slope, unbowed hand pyramid, firm walking faster by cutting corners of acute sidewalks swollen with sugar lazy day leaves strange aftertaste an inside moral war how to write haiku without ever stepping outside I ran so far away the big hungry winter cuddle then devour upend my dirty growl behind my angry howl warm hearth filled with stronger fire &ndash; hope in overcast skies little in this world decided by one person too much is

item.title: spring-summer 2020
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: spring gods falling from the sky &ndash; water rushes spring mother : carried bags of groceries her sun babies my spirit animal found his heavenly rest : the spring robin the green samurai &ndash; nears me with day light and his stone summer equivocation : to some I’m “weird,” or even “cool” those words mean nothing

item.title: fall-winter 2019-2020
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall subjects follow as queen bows her head &ndash; almost winter&rsquo;s turn flock of ducks survey centennial waters sun bids the cold

item.title: spring-summer 2019
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: spring spring’s robins &ndash; seeding the university soil my heart! raw bloom &ndash; the stately robin regales chapter ends because nobody seems to remember what happened a sharp edge just begging to make a cut. the cold hurts summer the wildfire &ndash; rays leave skin red and irradiated you have commitment lacking in dialogue : or so he said slithering sweat weaves from tree to tree : spotted light lone zinnia against the mad king he stands so tall

item.title: fall-winter 2018-2019
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: fall to her autumn means outside ball is everything grey room fits dying leaves, not how he feels winter before happened two fraternal hounds &ndash; dry yard grass no order in time&rsquo;s quanta next does not exist

item.title: kū português
item.dc:creator: Zach Stoebner
item.content:encoded: dia quente, raro -- surpreedente em Cascais que não atrevem nadar rare, hot day -- surprising in Cascais that they don't dare swim champô aguado passo do pente pelo cabelo e chove bate a janela watery shampoo comb passes through hair and rain batters the window ondas do Tejo relaxam-me nas costas -- ventos até inverno waves of the Tejo relax me on my back -- winds to winter ventos frios acima : metais bem empregados atrás da faixa amarela cold winds above : well-employed metals behind the yellow line fumo aqui escrito no prédio : nuvens em tudo smoke here written on the building : clouds everywhere bebo do tinto enquanto olho ao branco -- Camões vacia I drink from red while looking at white -- empty Camões porém ao ver o pássaro procura na telha cinzas but upon seeing the bird search on grey tiles táxi busca gajo taxi pick up guy café tenho de o derrotar -- a primavera já coffee I have to defeat it -- spring now medusa azul nade à casa inverno vem blue jellyfish may swim home winter comes Press play below for the "medusa azul" gif!
